meanings.definition: A disease affecting bee larvae, caused by bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The beekeeper was worried about the foulbrood spreading to other hives.
meanings.sent2: The foulbrood outbreak devastated the bee population in the area.
meanings.sent3: The bees had a meeting to discuss how to avoid catching foulbrood.
meanings.sent4: The foulbrood of negativity was infecting the once-happy community.
meanings.sent5: The foulbrood disease was like a silent killer among the bee larvae.

meanings.sent1: Leaving the food out in the sun will foulbrood it quickly.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally foulbrooded the surprise by mentioning it too soon.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to foulbrood the picnic by stealing all the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude foulbrooded the mood of the party.
meanings.sent5: The rain threatened to foulbrood their plans for a day at the beach.
